Job/Team Function: External Assurance Division: providing assurance to the Chief Executive, EFA, on the proper use of funds (£52 billion). Includes funds to schools (via direct support grant), academies, colleges (16-19 funding), private training/ independent specialist providers, including capital funding. Delivering assurance arrangements for the Teaching Agency, assessing the financial health of academies/colleges and supporting those in financial difficulty/financial intervention. Providing advice, assurance and financial viability matters to EFA colleagues. Responsibility for developing overall assurance arrangements, contributing widely to policy development, development of assurance arrangements for academies, and responsibility for the financial assessment of applications for free schools, UTCs, and special schools.

Name: Janet Renou
Job/Team Function: Regional Schools Commissioner for the West Midlands responsible for tackling educational underperformance and inadequate governance in open academies; approving new academy provision; managing the regional sponsor market for academies; and providing advice and taking decisions in relation to free schools, UTCs and studio schools.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Deputy Director of the Private Finance Team leads the team that is responsible for the commercial development and delivery of privately financed solutions as well as advice and assistance to operational privately financed deals. This role includes the management of the private finance arm of the Priority School Building Programme and the ongoing performance of the more delivery focused aspects of the traditional Private Finance Unit (PFU) role in respect of legacy education sector PFI contracts including BSF and pre-BSF schools PFI.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the free school application and assessment processes; programme management of the free schools programme including management information, communications and oversight of the Department’s relationship with New Schools Network; and the future development of the free school programme.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Vocational Education and 16-19 Strategy Division: responsible for all vocational education provision - including vocational qualifications, English and maths for young people who did not achieve A*-C at GCSE, and traineeships; the 16-19 provider base; and the wider 16+ skills strategy working closely with colleagues across DfE and BIS.

Name: Tom Shinner
Job/Team Function: Advising the Secretary of State, Permanent Secretary and DfE board on strategic policy and delivery; leading and managing the department’s strategy and delivery units.
Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the policy and implementation of the University Technical College & Studio School Programmes.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Lead one of the regional academies divisions in Academies Group. Work closely with three Regional Schools Commissioners to deliver the academies programme. This includes working with schools wanting to convert and brokerage of new sponsored academies; post-approval work to open all academy projects (converters and sponsored); and intervening in under-performing open academies. Also lead on all delivery processes and procedures across the other regional divisions.

Name: Paul Smith
Job/Team Function: Regional Schools Commissioner for the Lancashire and West Yorkshire: responsible for tackling educational underperformance and inadequate governance in open academies; approving new academy provision; managing the regional sponsor market for academies; and providing advice and taking decisions in relation to free schools, UTCs and studio schools.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Division is responsible for issues relating to school food, including free school meals. It is also responsible for post-16 participation in education and training including raising the participation age, young people not in employment, education or training (NEET), careers guidance and post-16 transport.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Lead the work on teaching schools, system leadership, school improvement and leadership supply.

Name: Helen Stephenson
Job/Team Function: Lead on Early Years, Child Poverty and Children's Services Strategy. Childcare market - driving supply and demand for quality childcare including childminder agencies, role of schools in providing early education and childcare and information to parents. Early Years curriculum and teaching - strengthening quality including EYFS, ratios reform, regulation and pedagogy. EYs Funding - improving affordability, funding reform, support to parents and delivery of funded early learning for 2 years. Responsible for Child Poverty Unit (joint unit with DWP) and sponsor Social Mobility and Child Poverty Commission and for the team which leads on strategy, business planning and VCS grants.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Programme Director for the delivery of the £2.4Bn Priority School Building Programme ('PSBP'). The PSBP is a centrally managed programme set up to address the condition needs of those schools most in need of urgent repair.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director, Independent Education and School Safeguarding: responsible for policy on the registration and regulation of the independent schools sector in England and taking regulatory action where schools fail to meet the independent school standards.  Also responsible for coordinating the Department's work on safeguarding in schools; and lead within the DfE for the cadet expansion programme, run jointly with MOD.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director responsible for leading implementation of the DfE Review in Infrastructure and Funding Directorate (IFD) and for leading delivery of the Fit for the Future change programme in the Education Funding Agency. Also responsible for IFD's project team, which is part of Education Funding Group.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The post of Deputy Director for Finance, Property and Technical in Free Schools Capital is responsible for supervising the: ŸAcquisition of temporary and permanent sites for locating schools, and securing appropriate planning consents ŸTechnical aspects of site inspection, selection, costing, preparation, contractor procurement and construction management ŸFinancial management: forecasting costs, operating cost controls, promoting efficiency and value for money, and ensuring affordability within the budget agreed with HM Treasury.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for: project work supporting GCSE reform.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: When the DfE’s Due Diligence and Counter Extremism function was established it was the first counter extremism division in government outside of the Home Office. The Group’s aims are to improve the resilience of the education and children’s services systems to extremist and radicalising influences; and to enable safeguarding to operate effectively in protecting vulnerable children and young people from extremist influences. The group is comprised of civil servants with support from specialists who have expertise in security matters.
Unit: Due Diligence and Counter Extremism Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Lead one of three regional delivery divisions in Academies Group. I working closely with two Regional Schools Commissioners to deliver the academies programme. This includes working with schools wanting to convert and brokerage of new sponsored academies; post-approval work to open all academy projects (converters and sponsored); and intervening in under-performing open academies. I also sponsor work to develop and refine our academy brokerage procedures across the other regional divisions.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: DD Change Division FCG: responsible for developing and implementing a finance and commercial business model that enables DfE to take better decisions.  In addition, strategic Business Partner for the Education Standards Directorate in DfE, supporting discussion/decision making within the senior management teams. Overview of finances, including, management information on programme and administrative costs, guidance on accounting , propriety/value for money; strategic financial analysis; engagement in the Department’s financial exercises.  Provision of financial services for the NCTL and STA.

Name: Isabelle Trowler
Job/Team Function: The Chief Social Worker for Children and Families works collaboratively with the Chief Social Worker for Adults, from the Office of the Chief Social Worker to: ŸSupport and challenge the profession to get the best help from social workers for childre0dults. Provide independent expert advice to ministers on social work reform, and the contribution of social workers to policy implementation. Provide leadership and work with key leaders in the profession and wider sector to drive forward improvement and reform social work programme. ŸChallenge weak practice to achieve decisive improvements in the quality of social work. ŸProvide leadership to principal social workers.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: Brian Tytherleigh
Job/Team Function: Provide direct support to the Chief Executive of the National College for Teaching and Learning, oversee accountability and performance, and ensure the agency operates and functions as a fully integrated and supportive component of the DfE.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Lead a number of projects to improve two key components of the childcare system. Firstly, effective management of the curriculum and regulatory framework that childcare providers need to comply with and be inspected against by Ofsted. Secondly, the early years and childcare workforce, where we are raising the status and qualifications of the profession, and increasing the ability of providers to improve their staff. My overall aim is to ensure that children access affordable, high-quality early education and childcare that keeps them safe and enables them to learn and develop so that they are ready to thrive at school.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy development of the legal and oversight frameworks of the academies and free schools programme, school intervention and school governance.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director for IT Core Business - Leading the reorganisation strand of IT Group’s Change Programme and oversight of business partnering; commercial and supplier management; strategy and architecture; group finance and staffing and the CIO’s office.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for assessment policy, including national assessment arrangements and in school assessment, and for the development of national tests and assessments. In developing tests, the division ensures that their work meets OfQual's common regulatory principles, including validity, reliability and freedom from bias. Also responsible for the development and delivery of the Professional Skills Tests for prospective teachers.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of a unit of 17 people advising Ministers on the distribution of the Department’s budget; carrying out longer term strategic thinking; analysing issues that affect the delivery of Ministers’ priorities; and building the policy-making capacity of the Department as proposed in the DfE Review.
Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Name: Mela Watts
Job/Team Function: Senior Responsible Officer for the Free Schools, University Technical Colleges & Studio Schools programmes - policy development and delivery.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Senior Adviser for the East Midlands, part of the Central and South West Territory. As senior manager for Service Delivery in the East Midlands, deal with institutions and key stakeholders based in the East Midlands.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Leading the HR Centres of Expertise strategic functions and services to the Department for Education, including Executive Agencies.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for: Reforming adoption, including speeding up the system, improving support services for children adopted from care, and ensuring the supply of adopters is sufficient to meet the needs of children waiting; Reform of the family justice system (particularly as it relates to children) and ensuring an effective public law process that avoids unnecessary delay; and Casework on inter-country adoptions and policy work to ensure that adoptions into and out of the UK comply with international safeguards.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for Young People’s Programme service delivery in northern England, covering the North East, North West and Yorkshire. Ensure delivery of EFA programmes (ESF, Youth Contract, etc.); monitor and support LAs in implementing High Needs Students funding; intervenes with inadequate providers and supports replacement of poor provision and filling of any gaps in provision. National lead for EFA on 16 – 18 Apprenticeships and Traineeships. Management of Apprenticeships budget, and programme development.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Deputy Director, Support is responsible for the Design & Specification Team, the ICT Team, School Assets Team, BSF and Academies programmes. All the teams have very different roles but essentially provide support to all the major capital schools building and condition programmes

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: DD for a variety of capital related things in EFA: School Place Planning; Capital Central Operations; Capital Delivery Design. And oversight of: Condition and Asset Management; Funding; Targeted Basic Need; Academy Transactions.

Job/Team Function: Leads School Support and Supply Division, which is responsible for policy on initial teacher training, teacher supply, school and system leadership and industrial relations.

Job/Team Function: Deputy Director in the Government Equalities Office and responsible for the LGB&T Policy & Director’s Office.

Job/Team Function: Director General, Finance and Corporate Directorate, is responsible for financial and commercial business, human resources, security and facilities. The DG also oversees the Department’s internal audit function as well as the DfE Change Programme.

Job/Team Function: Head of Communications, responsible for leading the external communications team (Campaigns and Press Office) to ensure that the work of the department is understood by the public, our partners and stakeholders.

Job/Team Function: DD with responsibility for Local Authority performance and intervention in children's social care services.

Job/Team Function: The National College for Teaching and Leadership (NCTL) is a new government agency created to enable and support the development of a self-improving, school-led system. The agency was formed from the merger, on 2 April 2013, of the National College for School Leadership and the Teaching Agency. NCTL has two key aims: improving the quality of the education workforce; and helping schools to help each other to improve.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: I am the Deputy Director responsible for the EFA's work in ensuring that existing school and college buildings are maintained appropriately.  This includes managing the teams responsible for the Property Data Survey and the Condition Improvement Fund.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
The Deputy Director for NCTL Business Services oversees the Programme Management Office, business transformation programmes, workforce planning and commercial advice for the agency. He liaises closely with shared service functions (HR, Finance, Commercial, Legal, IT) within DfE to ensure that the NCTL operates effectively and efficiently.
The Deputy Director for NCTL Business Services oversees the Programme Management Office, business transformation programmes, workforce planning and commercial advice for the agency. He liaises closely with shared service functions (HR, Finance, Commercial, Legal, IT) within DfE to ensure that the NCTL operates effectively and efficiently

Name: Graham Archer
Job/Team Function: Jointly leading the Children’s Services Policy Family which supports Ministers in developing and implementing policies relating to children’s issues. Responsible within the Policy Family for policy on safeguarding and child protection, social work reform, the children' social care innovation programme and local authority performance in relation to children's social care.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director for ACCPMD. We have responsibility for a wide range of work with open academies, including compliance with the funding agreement, the academies enquiry service, and communications with the academy sector

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: National College for Teaching and Leadership

Job/Team Function: Leads on Teachers’ Pensions and Deregulation, which includes teachers’ pensions policy and matters relating to reducing bureaucracy, employment law, teacher regulation, support staff and teacher workload

Name: Susan Baldwin
Job/Team Function: Academies and Maintained School Group:  The Director is the senior responsible owner for: academies and free schools financial management and funding agreement compliance; funding operations (all schools and academies); fraud awareness and the operational framework for anti-fraud activity across the EFA; and the EFA’s Change Programme

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
Test Operations Deputy Director in the Standards and Testing Agency (STA). The Division has responsibility for the delivery of assessments and testing in England, under statutory instruments, on behalf of the Secretary of State for Education.  In carrying out these functions, the division
Undertakes operational delivery of national curriculum tests and assessments; 
Ssupports the process of teacher assessment moderation; and
Ssupports schools and other stakeholders (by providing guidance, communications and helpdesk support). 
The Division also produces guidance and exemplification materials for the Early Years Foundation Stage Profile, Key Stage 1 and Key Stage 2 English writing teacher assessment and has a statutory function in respect of maladministration – where the validity of test results are in doubt for any reason.The Test Operations division took on responsibility for the general qualifications logistics service, provided to exam centres and examiners, on  1st April 2014

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: I lead the team and suppliers that deliver the Department's operational ICT services. This includes the day to day delivery of all “in-house” ICT services and infrastructure including desktop, email, telephony, video-conferencing, remote working and networks ensuring that they are reliable and that any incidents are quickly dealt with. The team also delivers third-party services and hosting of a range of business services, such as the MFD service. We also ensure that all the department’s systems and data are secure, backed-up and patched or updated in line with the latest security guidelines.

Name: Iain Bell
Job/Team Function: Director for Data and Education Standards Analysis

Name: Marcus Bell
Job/Team Function: Leads Teachers and Teaching, which is responsible for policy on the teaching profession, including training, standards, regulation, leadership, pay, pensions and industrial relations.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of the Ministerial and Public Communications Division, Departmental Strategy.  The Division supports Ministers by producing replies to MPs’ letters and Parliamentary Questions.  Responsible for responding, on behalf of Ministers, to correspondence and telephone enquiries received from education and children’s service professionals; and parents and members of the public.  Casework arising from complaints from parents and others about schools. The Department’s content on GOV.UK and channel shift to digital.
Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Name: Jennifer Bexon-Smith
Job/Team Function: Regional Schools Commissioner for  East Midlands and Humber  responsible for tackling educational underperformance and inadequate governance in open academies; approving new academy provision; managing the regional sponsor market for academies; and providing advice and taking decisions in relation to free schools, UTCs and studio schools.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for Special Educational Needs and Disability (SEND) policy and, in particular, the implementation of the reforms to the SEND system set out in the Children and Families Act, 2014.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director for Safeguarding and Child Protection. My responsibilities include developing policy on the child protection system from early help through children in need and those on child protection plans. This work links to other parts of children’s services policy - children in care, adoption and special educational needs and extends across the entire department where we challenge and advise on school safeguarding policy, extremism, LA interventions and SEN reform. The Unit is also involved with the cross government response to Rotherham and child sexual exploitation.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: I lead the Academies West and Academies North Divisions in Academies Group. I work with four Regional Schools Commissioners: Pank Patel  (West Midlands); David Carter (South West); Paul Smith (Lancashire and W Yorkshire) and Jan Renou (North)  and their offices. Academies West and Academies North Divisions are responsible in the two regions for: working with schools wanting to convert and brokerage of new sponsored academies; post-approval work to open all academy projects (converters and sponsored); and intervening in under-performing open academies. We also lead on all delivery processes and procedures across the other regional divisions. I am deputy head of the Darlingon site.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsibility for managing the market for Initial Teacher Training (ITT). This involves strategic oversight of the budget to fund ITT training and provide financial support for trainees. Responsible for working with Ofsted on regulating the quality of ITT and on the accreditation of ITT providers and for the collection of a wide range of trainee and labour market data to support the work of the Agency.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
Deputy Director Accountability and Flexible Resource Division, Education Standards Directorate.
Responsible for policy on school and college accountability  including inspection and managing the Department’s relationship with Ofsted.  I am also responsible for the ESD Flexible Resource Unit which deploys high calibre staff to priority projects across the Directorate

Name: Claire Burton
Job/Team Function: Chief Executive and Accounting Office for the Standards and Testing Agency: responsible for the development and delivery of statutory testing and assessment in England

Job/Team Function: Regional Schools Commissioner for the South West: responsible for tackling educational underperformance and inadequate governance in open academies; approving new academy provision; managing the regional sponsor market for academies; and providing advice and taking decisions in relation to free schools, UTCs and studio schools

National lead for the policy implementation and processes to manage provider failure, to deliver effective intervention to support improvement.

The unit is jointly sponsored by the Department for Work and Pensions, the Department for Education and HM Treasury

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Test Operations Deputy Director in the Standards and Testing Agency (STA). The Division has responsibility for the delivery of assessments and testing in England, under statutory instruments, on behalf of the Secretary of State for Education. In carrying out these functions, the division • undertakes operational delivery of national curriculum tests and assessments; • supports the process of teacher assessment moderation; and • supports schools and other stakeholders (by providing guidance, communications and helpdesk support). The Division also produces guidance and exemplification materials for the Early Years Foundation Stage Profile, Key Stage 1 and Key Stage 2 English writing teacher assessment and has a statutory function in respect of maladministration – where the validity of test results are in doubt for any reason.The Test Operations division took on responsibility for the general qualifications logistics service, provided to exam centres and examiners, on 1st April 2014

Job/Team Function: Finance Director for the Department. The central finance, estates and commercial teams report to this role, which also has board oversight of IT.

In addition he is responsible for programmes for school business managers and chairs of governors. The role involves building strong customer relationships with licensees and commissioned providers whilst holding them to account for high quality delivery and ensuring value for money

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director has overall responsibility for leading the Teacher Services Division of the National College for Teaching and Leadership. The Division supports the award of qualified teacher status, the investigation and consideration of cases where it is alleged that a teacher is guilty of unacceptable professional conduct, conduct that may bring the profession into disrepute or where the teacher has been convicted of a relevant offence. The Division maintains the list of prohibited teachers and makes it available. The Division acts as the appeal body for teachers who have failed their induction period.

Job/Team Function: Responsible for implementing the recommendations of the DfE Review in the Infrastructure and Funding Directorate: leading a programme of organisational change; and oversight of internal governance, performance reporting and business planning.

Unit: Strategic Analysis Research and Policy Impact Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: External Assurance Division: providing assurance to the Chief Executive, EFA, on the proper use of funds (£52 billion). Delivering assurance arrangements for the Teaching Agency, assessing the financial health of academies/colleges and supporting those in financial difficulty/financial intervention. Providing advice, assurance and financial viability matters to EFA colleagues. Responsibility for developing overall assurance arrangements, contributing widely to policy development, development of assurance arrangements for academies, and responsibility for the financial assessment of applications for free schools, UTCs, and special schools.

Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of Central Capital Unit. The Unit manages the Department’s capital budget, and is responsible for capital policy, including ensuring there are sufficient school places, and the condition and maintenance of the education estate

Name: Dugald Sandeman
Job/Team Function: The role of the Maintained Schools Division includes: The collection of financial data for maintained schools; The calculation and payment of funding allocations to local authorities of the Dedicated Schools Grant and the Pupil Premium; Gaining assurance from local authorities of the proper use of the grants for schools paid to them; The implementation of the school funding reforms announced in March 2012 for 2013-14; and the assessment of the appropriate amounts to be recouped from local authorities for expenditure on Academies in their areas.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: sessment processes; programme management of the free schools programme including management information, communications and oversight of the Department’s relationship with New Schools Network; and the future development of the free school programme

Job/Team Function: • Advising the Secretary of State, the Permanent Secretary and the DfE board on strategy and policy • Leading and managing the department’s strategy unit, performance unit, implementation group and policy advisers • Leading the department’s strategic and financial planning, including overseeing the DfE’s contribution to HM Treasury spending reviews • Assessing the department’s performance, reporting progress to the board and ministers, and ensuring risk is managed effectively • Supporting the effective implementation of high-priority initiatives
Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Academies East Division is responsible in the two regions for: working with schools wanting to convert and brokerage of new sponsored academies; post-approval work to open all academy projects (converters and sponsored); and intervening in under-performing open academies. We also lead on all delivery processes and procedures across the other regional divisions. I lead continuous improvement for the group and jointly at directorate level

Job/Team Function: The Division is responsible for issues relating to school food, including free school meals. Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: My statement on my role is: As a member of the senior leadership of NCTL, I lead the work on teaching schools, system leadership, school improvement and leadership supply

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director, Priority School Building Programme

Job/Team Function: Deputy Director, Independent Education and School Governance: responsible for policy on the registration and regulation of the independent schools sector in England and taking regulatory action where schools fail to meet the independent school standards. Also responsible for policy on the governance of maintained schools in England

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The post of Deputy Director for Finance, Programme, Property and Technical in Free Schools Capital is responsible for supervising the: • Acquisition of temporary and permanent sites for locating schools, and securing appropriate planning consents • Technical aspects of site inspection, selection, costing, preparation, contractor procurement and construction management • Structured planning, management and delivery of the programme to ensure fit-for-purpose schools open on time and budget • Financial management: forecasting costs, operating cost controls, promoting efficiency and value for money, and ensuring affordability within the budget agreed with HM Treasury.

Name: Charlie Taylor
Job/Team Function: The National College for Teaching and Leadership (NCTL) is a new government agency created to enable and support the development of a self-improving, school-led system. The agency was formed from the merger, on 2 April 2013, of the National College for School Leadership and the Teaching Agency. NCTL has two key aims: improving the quality of the education workforce; and helping schools to help each other to improve

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Due Diligence and Counter Extremism Division (previously known as the Preventing Extremism Unit) was established in October 2010 and was the first counter extremism division in government outside of the Home Office. The Division’s aim is to ensure that children and young people in England are safeguarded from extremists and extremist views in schools or in out of school hours learning, and prevent young people from becoming radicalised or acting on extreme views. The division is comprised of civil servants with support from specialists who have expertise in security matters

Name: N/D

As Chief Executive, responsible for the corporate performance of the STA and for setting its strategic direction in line with Ministerial priorities.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Joint Head of Business Partner division. Business Partner for the Education Standards Directorate and the corporate centre in DfE, supporting discussion/decision making within the senior management teams. Overview of finances, including, management information on programme and administrative costs, guidance on accounting , propriety/value for money; strategic financial analysis; engagement in the Department’s financial exercises. Provision of financial services for the NCTL and STA.

Name: Isabelle Trowler
Job/Team Function: The Chief Social Worker for Children and Families works collaboratively with the Chief Social Worker for Adults. Together they work from the Office of the Chief Social Worker to: • support and challenge the profession to ensure that children and adults get the best possible help from social workers • provide independent expert advice to ministers on social work reform, and the contribution of social work and social workers to policy implementation more generally • provide leadership and work with key leaders in the profession and wider sector to drive forward the improvement and reform programme for social work • challenge weak practice to achieve decisive improvements in the quality of social work • provide leadership to the network of principal social workers
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: Brian Tytherleigh
Job/Team Function: Provide direct support to the Chief Executive of the National College for Teaching and Learning, oversee accountability and performance, and ensure the agency operates and functions as a fully integrated and supportive component of the DfE.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: I lead a number of projects to improve two key components of the childcare system. Firstly, effective management of the curriculum and regulatory framework that childcare providers need to comply with and be inspected against by Ofsted. Secondly, the early years and childcare workforce, where we are raising the status and qualifications of the profession, and increasing the ability of providers to improve their staff. My overall aim is to ensure that children access affordable, high-quality early education and childcare that keeps them safe and enables them to learn and develop so that they are ready to thrive at school.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Job/Team Function: Test Operations Deputy Director in the Standards and Testing Agency (STA). In carrying out these functions, the division • undertakes operational delivery of national curriculum tests and assessments; • supports the process of teacher assessment moderation; and • supports schools and other stakeholders (by providing guidance, communications and helpdesk support). The Division also produces guidance and exemplification materials for the Early Years Foundation Stage Profile, Key Stage 1 and Key Stage 2 English writing teacher assessment and has a statutory function in respect of maladministration – where the validity of test results are in doubt for any reason.The Test Operations division took on responsibility for the general qualifications logistics service, provided to exam centres and examiners, on 1st April 2014

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Deputy Director for Targeted Capital Programmes is responsible for the day to day management of the Targeted Capital Programme team, whilst reporting to the Divisional Director Programme Delivery. They lead an internal team of Project Directors to work with schools, sponsors, Academy Trusts, Local Authorities and other stakeholders to deliver the Academy capital build projects, the Academies Maintenance Fund, TBNP and the remaining BSF schemes.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director Data and Funding

Name: Chris Wormald
Job/Team Function: The Permanent Secretary has three overall roles: 1. The Head of the Department. 2. The Accounting Officer. 3. The Chief Policy Non-Political Policy Advisor to the Secretary of State. He is responsible for the overall management of the Department and is accountable to Parliament for the actions the Department takes and the way in which taxpayers’ money is spent.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Leads Supply Division, which is responsible for policy on initial teacher training and school system leadership and industrial relations.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director responsible for the EFA's work in ensuring that existing school and college buildings are maintained appropriately. This includes managing the teams responsible for the Property Data Survey and the Condition Improvement Fund

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: – Head of Procurement, Deputy Director, Commercial Division. Responsible for ensuring that the commercial and procurement activity of the Department for Education and its Executive Agencies supports Departmental priorities and delivers outstanding value for money. Also responsible for developing commercial solutions for schools

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director for free schools capital in the South of England

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To ensure the Secretary of State and Ministers are well supported in all aspects of their roles by the Private Office Department of State function.
Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Future Academy System Team develop policy regarding the future of the school system and how the academy programme should evolve, including the role of Regional Schools Commissioners and Headteacher Boards and how their role should develop

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director in the Academies Group: responsible for, in the for the South East and South London, and NW London and South Central Regional Schools Commissioner (RSC) regions, developing appropriate academy solutions to transform underperforming LA-maintained schools; handling and delivery of converter and sponsored academy projects from application through to opening; and, working to improve underperforming academies.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy on open free schools and for taking forward individual proposals in the North East London and East of England; West Midlands; South West; East Midlands and the Humber; Lancashire and West Yorkshire; and North regions
